articles.author: Ted Hesson, Mica Rosenberg
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden on Tuesday instituted a broad asylum ban on migrants caught illegally crossing the U.S.-Mexico border, a major enforcement move in the run-up to November elections that will decide control of the White House.
articles.title: Biden imposes sweeping asylum ban at US-Mexico border

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi was set to meet his allies on Wednesday to discuss forming the government, a day after his Hindu nationalist party lost its outright majority in parliament in a surprise election verdict.
articles.title: India's Modi, allies to meet after humbling election verdict

articles.author: Elizabeth Piper, Andrew Macaskill, William James
articles.description: Britain's Rishi Sunak and Labour's Keir Starmer went head-to-head on Tuesday over how to boost the country's economy, with the prime minister accusing the opposition party of wanting to increase taxes if it wins power at a July 4 election.
articles.title: In testy debate, Britain's Sunak, Starmer go head to head on the economy

articles.author: Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: The Republican-led U.S. House of Representatives passed legislation that would impose sanctions on the International Criminal Court over its prosecutor's decision to seek arrest warrants for Israeli officials related to the war in Gaza.
articles.title: US House passes Republican bill to sanction International Criminal Court over Israel

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Henriette Chacar
articles.description: Israeli shelling and airstrikes killed at least 19 people in central and south Gaza on Tuesday including two policemen who were helping protect humanitarian aid deliveries in the southern city of Rafah, Palestinian medics said.
articles.title: Israel strikes, shelling kill 19 in Gaza amid manoeuvring on ceasefire quest

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: This account, based on a Reuters review of protest footage, previously unreported arrest notices and interviews, examines one of the economic protests that have proliferated in China since 2022, a period in which hundreds of thousands have lost homes in a property bust and fallen victim to investment scams.
articles.title: Chinese who lost money in bank fraud detained for months after protest

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: Donald Trump on Tuesday asked the judge who oversaw his criminal trial on charges stemming from hush money paid to a porn star to lift a gag order on the case, in which the former U.S. president was convicted last week.
articles.title: Trump asks judge to lift gag order after conviction in hush money case

articles.author: Jeff Mason
articles.description: President Joe Biden heads to France on Tuesday to commemorate the 80th anniversary of D-Day on a trip designed to underscore his commitment to U.S. allies in Europe and contrast his vision of democracy with his 2024 political opponent, Donald Trump.
articles.title: Biden heads to France for D-Day anniversary, democracy speech

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: The United States and its G7 partners are making progress on finding ways to provide more urgently needed funds to Ukraine by tapping the value of profits earned on frozen Russian assets, a senior U.S. Treasury official said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Allies make progress on using Russian assets for Ukraine, U.S. official says

articles.author: Laura Gottesdiener, Stephen Eisenhammer
articles.description: Claudia Sheinbaum's landslide win gives her an unprecedented mandate in Mexico, but success in handling the country's key ally and trading partner the United States hinges on how she can navigate the relationship and a possible clash if Donald Trump returns to the White House, according to former diplomats and analysts.
articles.title: Mexico's Sheinbaum unlikely to repeat mentor's Trump 'bromance'
